comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Constant name is too vague. I will need something similar and this constant says nothing about that this task is for paid leave only. Why not call it ABSENCE_PAID_LEAVE_CLAIM CREATION_FAILURE_TASK_NAME

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Javadoc and logic is wrong. Javadoc indicates that this is a property in config, where as this is the actual task name. This class is supposed to be for reading properties from XML. Hence, the name AND value here are wrong. This constant should be the name of the property in XML, such as ABSENCE_PAID_LEAVE_CLAIM_CREATION_FAILURE_TASK_NAME_PROPERTY_NAME = "AbsencePaidLeaveClaimCreationFailureTaskName", and it should have a value configued Absence Paid Leave Claim Creation Failure. There should then be a method getAbsencePaidLeaveClaimCreationFailureTaskName(), which returns the value from config. Add test for same.
Assuming the task name is to be configurable.

comments.comment: Name is too vague, what is this for? Doesnt seem to be used anywhere outside of unit tests

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-3313 - update to composer configuration and DTO amendments

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This should have no reference to contract BOs. That is an implementation detail that CreatePaidLeaveClaimAndBenefitImpl knows about. The interface is completely agnostic about how the communication is done. Move all refernce to contract DTO, WSC from this interface (and others) and onto the implementation class.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: sEems to have been fixed along the way

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I think the DTO in the package name should be "dto", we always use small letters for packages, as per java convention

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment: The DTO's are migrating into claims, the new package in claims is com.fineos.claims.external.dto.bo which will satisfy the naming convention issue

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Do we need this comment anymore? Or do we reword this to be more inline as to what we're doing here?

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Class moved to claims and comment removed

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I think this file should be renamed to 23absence_claimsintegration.xml. There is no guarantee we will always use web service composer, so the name is misleading.

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment:
I would be of the opion that all composer activity would be kept in a composer configuration file and if we migrate from composer we should create a separate configuration file. Would like to mix composer configuration with alternative web services configuration
If not and we want to keep all web services coinfiguration together I would give it a different name 23absence_webservices.xml or 23absence_integration.xml
23absence_claimsintegration.xml gives the impression this only claims specific configuration, but if we interface with different services / products the claims name is misleading could lead to a composer config file per product / service

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment: On line 1, meant to say Wouldnt like to mix composer configuration with alternative web services configuration

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
I was proposing to follow the claims lead, they have 75ws_composer.xml, which only has the configuration of all the WSC services that we call, nothing more.
Everything else related with their integration with absence (e.g. task types for errors etc) lives in an XML called 23claimsforabsence.xml. Therefore, I thought we should have similar approach, and have all the rest of config related with integration in 23absence_claimsintegration.xml. If we did have configuration for integrations with policy, then that would go into 23absence_policyintegration.xml etc.

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment: Added new Task http://jira/browse/FAB-3820 to complete the composer xml refactoring

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Extract constant for service name

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: I;ve already done this in http://iedev317.development.fineos.com/reviewboard/r/70433/

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I dont think these shuodl be void, they should return some indications of the result, to allow the facade to react to same. The ICreatePaidLeaveClaimAndBenefit implementation should only know how to call WSC, it shouldnt be handling the result.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: I've already done this in http://iedev317.development.fineos.com/reviewboard/r/70737, returns a map of params
